name: Hardware write blockers
description: A hardware write blocking device [should] prevent any change to data in the user area of a hard drive while allowing access to all data on a hard drive. (Lyle 2006)
details: Note that "Sometimes it may be desirable to change a drive configuration to obtain access to otherwise hidden sectors, for example, such as within an HPA (host protected area)." (Lyle 2006)
references: Lyle, J.R., 2006. A strategy for testing hardware write block devices. digital investigation, 3, pp.3-9.
